revised_title: Spherulitic Crystallization and Morphology of Melt-Crystallized Poly(4-methylpentene-1)
tldr: The authors study the spherulitic crystallization and internal lamellar microstructure of melt-crystallized poly(4-methylpentene-1). They find that growth proceeds by branching and divergence of individual dominant lamellae, forming a framework within which subsidiary growth occurs, eventually giving spherulites. The essential origin of spherulitic growth is identified as the tendency for adjacent dominant lamellae to diverge from spatially distributed branch points.
